It integrates with molecular dynamics (MD) and density functional theory (DFT) engines to compute properties like thermal conductivity, refractive index, and density for large sets of polymers.

tools.detailed_description: g_mmpbsa is a tool to calculate binding free energy using the MM-PBSA (Molecular Mechanics Poisson-Boltzmann Surface Area) method. It is designed to work with GROMACS trajectories to estimate interaction energies in biomolecular complexes.

tools.name: UAMMD
tools.one_line_profile: CUDA-based generic molecular and hydrodynamics simulation engine
tools.detailed_description: UAMMD is a CUDA-accelerated simulation framework for soft matter physics. It supports Molecular Dynamics, Brownian Dynamics, and Hydrodynamics, allowing users to construct generic system simulations using a modular approach.

tools.detailed_description: A C++ tool developed by the Rowley Group to calculate autocorrelation functions from time series data generated by molecular simulation codes like NAMD. It is useful for analyzing dynamic properties from trajectory data.

tools.name: NNP-MM

tools.detailed_description: Scripts and interface code to couple TorchANI (a neural network potential library) with the NAMD molecular dynamics engine, enabling QM/MM-style simulations where the QM region is described by a machine learning potential.

tools.name: PLAMS
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for automating molecular simulations
tools.detailed_description: PLAMS (Python Library for Automating Molecular Simulations) is a powerful library to manage and automate computational chemistry workflows. It provides interfaces to various simulation engines (like ADF, BAND, Quantum ESPRESSO) and handles job execution and data management.

tools.name: pycp2k

tools.name: SPARC

tools.detailed_description: SPARC (Simulation Package for Ab-initio Real-space Calculations) is a code for performing electronic structure calculations using Density Functional Theory (DFT) with a real-space finite-difference method. It is designed for high-performance computing and scalability.

tools.name: PySAGES

tools.name: SSAGES
tools.one_line_profile: Engine-agnostic library for advanced sampling in MD
tools.detailed_description: SSAGES (Software Suite for Advanced General Ensemble Simulations) is a C++ based engine-agnostic library that couples with various molecular dynamics codes (LAMMPS, GROMACS, etc.) to perform advanced sampling techniques like Metadynamics and Forward Flux Sampling.

tools.name: SWIFT
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance SPH and N-body solver for astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: SWIFT is a modern, high-performance particle-based code designed for astrophysics and cosmology simulations. It implements Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) and gravity solvers, optimized for modern supercomputing architectures.

tools.name: XtraCrysPy

tools.name: NBodySimulator.jl

tools.name: Smilei

tools.name: mdio-python

tools.name: GMXvg

tools.detailed_description: A Python-based utility for parsing and plotting XVG graph files generated by GROMACS molecular dynamics simulations. It simplifies the visualization of simulation metrics like energy, RMSD, and temperature.

tools.name: Lammps_tools

tools.name: Spectral-decomposition-python-tools

tools.detailed_description: Python tools for computing spectral heat current distributions using data from Non-Equilibrium Molecular Dynamics (NEMD) simulations performed with LAMMPS. Useful for studying thermal transport properties.

tools.name: Tinker

It supports a wide variety of force fields, including polarizable models (AMOEBAPlus), and provides tools for energy minimization, dynamics, and analysis.

tools.name: TIES_MD

tools.name: ThermalTools

tools.name: gmx_MMPBSA

tools.name: AutoMD
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper scripts to simplify molecular dynamics simulation workflows
tools.detailed_description: A set of shell scripts and tools designed to lower the barrier to entry for performing molecular dynamics simulations, automating common setup and execution steps for standard MD engines.

tools.name: YAMACS

tools.detailed_description: A set of plugins that bridge the YASARA molecular modeling environment with GROMACS, allowing users to leverage YASARA's visualization and modeling capabilities alongside GROMACS's simulation power.

tools.name: lammps-data-processing
tools.one_line_profile: Python scripts for processing and visualizing LAMMPS simulation data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts developed to post-process data files exported from LAMMPS simulations. It includes functionality for data analysis and generating scientific plots suitable for publication.

tools.name: OpenABC

tools.name: AbacusSummit

tools.name: LAMMPS (AdvanceSoft)

tools.name: aiida-cp2k

tools.one_line_profile: SPH rendering framework for cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for rendering and visualizing cosmological simulations using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) scheme, allowing for high-quality visualization of large-scale particle data.

tools.name: grav_sim
tools.one_line_profile: N-body gravity simulation library with C and Python API
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing N-body gravity simulations, providing both C and Python APIs. It allows users to simulate gravitational interactions in astrophysical systems with high performance.

tools.name: atomify
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based real-time molecular dynamics visualization
tools.detailed_description: A tool that enables real-time molecular dynamics simulations and visualization directly in a web browser using LAMMPS. It serves as a platform for interactive exploration of molecular systems.

tools.name: Halotools
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for modeling large-scale structure and galaxy evolution
tools.detailed_description: A specialized Python package for studying large-scale structure, cosmology, and galaxy evolution. It provides tools to populate N-body simulations with galaxies using Halo Occupation Distribution (HOD) and other semi-empirical models.

tools.name: CP2K_Editor
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for creating and editing CP2K input files
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface designed to assist users in creating and editing complex input files for the CP2K atomistic simulation software, simplifying the setup process for calculations.

tools.name: MDBenchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to generate, start, and analyze benchmarks for molecular dynamics simulations
tools.detailed_description: MDBenchmark is a Python package designed to automate the benchmarking of molecular dynamics simulations. It handles the generation of input files, submission of jobs to clusters, and analysis of performance data to help researchers optimize simulation parameters.

tools.name: CP2K QM/MM Input Scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of Python scripts for preparing CP2K QM/MM input files
tools.detailed_description: A set of utility scripts provided by BioExcel to facilitate the creation of complex QM/MM input files for the CP2K software package, streamlining the setup process for hybrid quantum mechanics/molecular mechanics simulations.

tools.name: mdgen
tools.one_line_profile: Generative modeling library for molecular dynamics trajectories
tools.detailed_description: mdgen is a library for the generative modeling of molecular dynamics trajectories. It leverages machine learning techniques to generate synthetic trajectories that capture the statistical properties of molecular systems.

tools.name: pdbremix
tools.one_line_profile: Library to analyze PDB files and run molecular dynamics simulations
tools.detailed_description: pdbremix is a Python library that provides an interface to analyze PDB files, setup and run molecular dynamics simulations (wrapping tools like GROMACS or NAMD), and analyze the resulting trajectories.

tools.name: GPUMD
tools.one_line_profile: General-purpose graphics processing units molecular dynamics package
tools.detailed_description: GPUMD is a highly efficient molecular dynamics simulation package designed to run entirely on GPUs. It supports various force fields and is optimized for large-scale simulations and thermal transport calculations.

tools.name: OpenMM-Python-Force
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM plugin to define forces using Python code
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the OpenMM molecular simulation toolkit that allows users to define custom forces and potential energy functions using pure Python code, facilitating rapid prototyping and integration of complex force fields.

tools.name: BAMBOO
tools.one_line_profile: AI-driven machine learning force field for electrolyte simulations
tools.detailed_description: BAMBOO (Bytedance AI Molecular BOOster) is a machine learning force field framework designed for precise and efficient simulations, with a specific focus on electrolyte systems.

tools.name: FLOWVPM.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Meshless large eddy simulation via reformulated vortex particle method
tools.detailed_description: FLOWVPM.jl is a Julia package for performing meshless large eddy simulations (LES) using the reformulated vortex particle method (VPM), suitable for fluid dynamics research.

tools.name: DL_POLY
tools.one_line_profile: General purpose classical molecular dynamics simulation software
tools.detailed_description: DL_POLY is a general-purpose classical molecular dynamics (MD) simulation software package developed at Daresbury Laboratory. It is designed to support a wide range of molecular systems and force fields.

tools.name: martinize.py
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to create coarse-grained Martini input files for GROMACS
tools.detailed_description: martinize.py is a widely used script/tool for converting atomistic PDB structures into coarse-grained Martini force field topologies and input files suitable for GROMACS simulations.

tools.name: NeuralMD
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network-based molecular dynamics for protein-ligand binding
tools.detailed_description: NeuralMD is a software framework that utilizes neural networks to enhance molecular dynamics simulations, specifically targeting protein-ligand binding processes to improve sampling efficiency and accuracy.

tools.name: ai2-kit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for AI-enhanced ab initio computational chemistry
tools.detailed_description: ai2-kit is a toolkit designed to integrate artificial intelligence with ab initio computational chemistry methods. It provides workflows and tools to accelerate simulations and analysis in materials science.

tools.name: openmmtools
tools.one_line_profile: Batteries-included toolkit for OpenMM molecular simulation
tools.detailed_description: openmmtools is a comprehensive collection of tools and utilities for the OpenMM molecular simulation engine. It includes integrators, test systems, and MCM moves to facilitate advanced MD simulations and method development.

tools.name: perses
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for alchemical free energy calculations and expanded ensembles
tools.detailed_description: Perses is a Python framework for performing alchemical free energy calculations and exploring chemical space using expanded ensemble simulations, built on top of OpenMM.

tools.name: Yank
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated framework for alchemical free energy calculations
tools.detailed_description: YANK is an open, extensible Python framework for performing GPU-accelerated alchemical free energy calculations, particularly for ligand binding, using the OpenMM engine.

tools.name: Streamd
tools.one_line_profile: Fully automated high-throughput molecular dynamics pipeline
tools.detailed_description: Streamd is a Python-based pipeline designed to fully automate high-throughput molecular dynamics simulations, handling system preparation, equilibration, production runs, and analysis.

tools.name: flowerMD
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible library of workflows for molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: flowerMD provides a flexible library of organic workflows and extensible recipes for setting up and running molecular dynamics simulations, aiming to simplify complex simulation protocols.

tools.name: CP2K
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package
tools.detailed_description: CP2K is a quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package that can perform atomistic simulations of solid state, liquid, molecular, and biological systems. It provides a general framework for different modeling methods such as DFT using the mixed Gaussian and plane waves approaches (GPW) and classical molecular dynamics.

tools.name: cp2k-input-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Python tools for validating and generating CP2K input files
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to handle CP2K input files with full validation capabilities, including preprocessing features to ensure input correctness for molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: cp2k-output-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Python tools for parsing CP2K output files
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python utilities for parsing and handling output files generated by the CP2K quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package.

tools.name: DBCSR
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed Block Compressed Sparse Row matrix library
tools.detailed_description: A library for sparse matrix operations designed to efficiently handle large-scale electronic structure calculations, serving as a core component for the CP2K simulation package.

tools.name: ufedmm
tools.one_line_profile: Unified Free Energy Dynamics simulations with OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that implements Unified Free Energy Dynamics (UFED) for enhanced sampling simulations using the OpenMM molecular dynamics engine.

tools.name: RMD_Digging
tools.one_line_profile: Pre- and post-processing tools for ReaxFF simulations
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based toolkit for reactive molecular dynamics (ReaxFF) simulations, offering functionality for force field parameter formatting, structural statistical analysis, and visualization output.

tools.name: SPLASH
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualisation tool for SPH simulations
tools.detailed_description: A visualization and plotting tool designed for Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulations, utilizing kernel interpolation for rendering scientific data.

tools.name: MDSynthesis
tools.one_line_profile: Logistics and persistence engine for MD trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides a framework for managing, storing, and analyzing molecular dynamics simulation data and trajectories, facilitating persistent analysis workflows.

tools.name: DeePMD-GNN
tools.one_line_profile: DeePMD-kit plugin for graph neural network models
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the DeePMD-kit package that enables the use of various graph neural network (GNN) models for molecular dynamics and potential energy surface representation.

tools.name: DeePMD-kit
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning package for many-body potential energy representation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning package designed to generate many-body potential energy representations for molecular dynamics simulations, enabling high-accuracy atomistic modeling.

tools.name: ReacNetGenerator
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic reaction network generator for reactive MD
tools.detailed_description: A tool for automatically extracting and generating reaction networks from reactive molecular dynamics (ReaxFF or ab initio MD) simulation trajectories.

tools.name: Cheetah
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and differentiable particle accelerator optics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for fast, differentiable simulation of particle accelerator optics, designed to support reinforcement learning and optimization applications in accelerator physics.

tools.name: PhaseForge
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for alloy phase diagram prediction using MLIPs
tools.detailed_description: A framework integrating machine learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs) with ATAT and CALPHAD modeling to predict alloy phase diagrams, including tools for structure relaxation and TDB generation.

tools.name: pmwd
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Cosmological Forward Model
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable cosmological particle-mesh N-body library for forward modeling of structure formation in the universe, enabling gradient-based inference and optimization.

tools.name: pwtools
tools.one_line_profile: Pre- and postprocessing package for atomistic calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for pre- and post-processing of atomistic calculations, supporting multiple codes like Quantum Espresso, CPMD, CP2K, and LAMMPS, with powerful parsers and data structures.

tools.name: EPOCH
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-cell code for plasma physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: A multi-dimensional Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code designed for plasma physics simulations, widely used for studying laser-plasma interactions and high-energy density physics.

tools.name: Grand
tools.one_line_profile: GCMC sampling for water molecules in OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A Python module that implements Grand Canonical Monte Carlo (GCMC) insertions and deletions of water molecules within OpenMM simulations, facilitating constant chemical potential simulations.

tools.name: Pylians3
tools.one_line_profile: Libraries to analyze numerical simulations (N-body/Hydro) for cosmology
tools.detailed_description: Pylians3 is a set of Python libraries designed to analyze numerical simulations, specifically focusing on cosmological N-body and hydrodynamic simulations (e.g., Quijote simulations). It provides tools for calculating power spectra, correlation functions, and other statistical measures.

tools.name: Quijote-simulations
tools.one_line_profile: Large suite of N-body simulations for cosmological machine learning
tools.detailed_description: The Quijote simulations are a set of 44,100 full N-body simulations designed to quantify the information content of cosmological observables and to train machine learning models. This repository serves as the entry point and documentation for accessing this scientific dataset.

tools.name: Cube-Toolz
tools.one_line_profile: Python tool to manipulate Gaussian cube files
tools.detailed_description: Cube-Toolz is a Python utility for manipulating Gaussian cube files, which are volumetric data files commonly used in computational chemistry to represent electron density or orbitals. It allows for operations like addition, subtraction, and integration of cube data.

tools.name: so3lr
tools.one_line_profile: SO3krates and Universal Pairwise Force Field for Molecular Simulation
tools.detailed_description: so3lr provides an implementation of the SO3krates model and a universal pairwise force field. It is designed for molecular simulations, offering machine learning-based potentials that respect rotational symmetries.

tools.name: LibGeoDecomp
tools.one_line_profile: Library for parallel computer simulations (stencil, N-body, mesh-free)
tools.detailed_description: LibGeoDecomp is a C++ library for developing parallel computer simulations, supporting stencil codes, mesh-free methods, and N-body problems. It handles parallelization details, allowing scaling from smartphones to supercomputers.

tools.name: GSD
tools.one_line_profile: File format and library for HOOMD-blue data
tools.detailed_description: GSD (General Simulation Data) is a file format specification and a Python library for reading and writing GSD files. It is the native file format for HOOMD-blue but is designed to be efficient and generic for storing particle simulation trajectories.

tools.name: HOOMD-blue
tools.one_line_profile: General-purpose particle simulation toolkit optimized for GPUs
tools.detailed_description: HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit. It performs Molecular Dynamics (MD) and Monte Carlo (MC) simulations of particles on CPUs and GPUs, designed for high performance and scalability in soft matter research.

tools.name: differentiable-atomistic-potentials
tools.one_line_profile: Automatically differentiable atomistic potentials for molecular simulations
tools.detailed_description: This repository provides implementations of differentiable atomistic potentials, enabling the use of automatic differentiation for tasks like force matching, property optimization, and inverse design in molecular simulations.

tools.name: Grappa
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learned Molecular Mechanics force field
tools.detailed_description: Grappa is a machine-learned molecular mechanics force field designed to improve accuracy over traditional force fields while maintaining computational efficiency. It integrates with GROMACS and OpenMM.

tools.name: GROMACS
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance molecular dynamics package
tools.detailed_description: GROMACS is a versatile package to perform molecular dynamics, i.e. simulate the Newtonian equations of motion for systems with hundreds to millions of particles. It is primarily designed for biochemical molecules like proteins, lipids, and nucleic acids that have a lot of complicated bonded interactions.

tools.name: GASP-python
tools.one_line_profile: Genetic algorithm for structure and phase prediction
tools.detailed_description: GASP (Genetic Algorithm for Structure and Phase prediction) is a Python code that interfaces with energy codes (like GULP, LAMMPS, VASP) to predict crystal structures and phases using genetic algorithms.

tools.name: lammps-logfile
tools.one_line_profile: Python reader for LAMMPS log files
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python tool to parse and read log files produced by LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations into simple data structures for analysis.

tools.name: GRO2LAM
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from GROMACS to LAMMPS simulation formats
tools.detailed_description: GRO2LAM is a tool designed to convert molecular dynamics simulation files from GROMACS format to LAMMPS format, facilitating interoperability between these two major simulation engines.

tools.name: GDPy
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for generating Deep Potential models with Python
tools.detailed_description: GDPy is a Python package designed to facilitate the generation of Deep Potential (DP) models. It provides tools to interface with VASP for data generation and DeepMD-kit for model training.

tools.name: RASPA2
tools.one_line_profile: Classical molecular simulation code for adsorption and diffusion
tools.detailed_description: RASPA2 is a general-purpose software package for simulating adsorption and diffusion of molecules in flexible nanoporous materials. It uses Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics methods.

tools.name: ScatterNet
tools.one_line_profile: Nanophotonic particle simulation and inverse design using neural networks
tools.detailed_description: ScatterNet provides code for simulating nanophotonic particles and performing inverse design using artificial neural networks. It addresses the forward and inverse scattering problems.

tools.name: unomd
tools.one_line_profile: Automated molecular dynamics simulation of protein-ligand complexes
tools.detailed_description: unomd is a Python package that streamlines the process of running molecular dynamics simulations for protein-ligand complexes. It automates system preparation, parameterization, and simulation execution.

tools.name: ommprotocol
tools.one_line_profile: Command line interface for OpenMM molecular dynamics simulations
tools.detailed_description: ommprotocol is a command-line application designed to launch and manage molecular dynamics simulations using the OpenMM engine. It simplifies the execution of MD protocols without writing custom Python scripts.

tools.name: gromacs_ff
tools.one_line_profile: Repository of trusted force field files for GROMACS
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains a collection of trusted and validated force field files for use with the GROMACS molecular simulation toolkit, serving as a reference dataset for simulations.

tools.name: PyCGTOOL
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating coarse-grained molecular dynamics models from atomistic trajectories
tools.detailed_description: PyCGTOOL aids in the parameterisation of coarse-grained (CG) molecular mechanics models. It processes atomistic trajectories to generate CG topologies and parameters (equilibrium bonds/angles) for use in MD engines like GROMACS.

tools.name: Negative Mass Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: N-body simulation code for exploring negative mass dynamics in cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based N-body simulation code designed to investigate the dynamics of systems containing negative mass particles, primarily for cosmological research and dark fluid theories.

tools.name: JAX-MD
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated, differentiable molecular dynamics with JAX
tools.detailed_description: JAX-MD is a framework for performing molecular dynamics simulations that are hardware accelerated (GPU/TPU) and end-to-end differentiable. It enables research into machine learning potentials and optimization of physical parameters.

tools.name: GadgetViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualisation tool for Gadget and SWIFT N-body simulations
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight tool written in Fortran/C for visualizing outputs from Gadget and SWIFT cosmological N-body/SPH simulation codes. It supports interactive inspection of particle data.

tools.name: Moltemplate
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform text-based molecule builder for LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: Moltemplate is a general cross-platform tool for preparing simulations of molecules and complex molecular assemblies. It is primarily used to generate input files (data and input scripts) for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics engine.

tools.name: Amaceing Toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Input generation and post-processing for atomistic simulations (CP2K, MACE, etc.)
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the creation of input files for various quantum chemistry and machine learning potential codes (CP2K, MACE-torch, SevenNet) and assist in the post-processing of simulation results.

tools.name: Zeno
tools.one_line_profile: Environment for N-body and SPH simulation and analysis
tools.detailed_description: Zeno is a software environment for N-body and Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulations, developed by Joshua Barnes. It includes tools for simulation, analysis, and visualization of astrophysical systems.

tools.name: NRI-MD
tools.one_line_profile: Neural Relational Inference for Molecular Dynamics
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Neural Relational Inference (NRI) specifically adapted for analyzing molecular dynamics simulations. It infers interaction graphs and dynamics from trajectory data.

tools.name: MCMD
tools.one_line_profile: Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics Simulation Package
tools.detailed_description: MCMD is a C++ software package for performing Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics simulations, supporting various ensembles and potential models.

tools.name: kinisi
tools.one_line_profile: Estimation of diffusion properties from MD simulations
tools.detailed_description: Kinisi is a Python package for analyzing diffusion in molecular dynamics simulations. It uses Bayesian inference to estimate diffusion coefficients and their uncertainties from trajectory data.

tools.name: interfaceff2gro
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to prepare GROMACS input files using INTERFACE forcefield
tools.detailed_description: A script designed to facilitate the use of the INTERFACE force field (for bio-inorganic interfaces) within the GROMACS molecular dynamics engine by converting parameters and generating input files.

tools.name: LAMMPS
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator
tools.detailed_description: LAMMPS is a classical molecular dynamics code with a focus on materials modeling. It's an open-source code designed to run efficiently on parallel computers, supporting a wide range of interatomic potentials and boundary conditions.

tools.name: Pizza.py
tools.one_line_profile: Pre- and post-processing toolkit for LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: Pizza.py is a loosely integrated collection of tools written in Python, designed to provide pre- and post-processing capabilities for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics package, including file conversion and data analysis.

tools.name: OPLSAA-DB
tools.one_line_profile: Database of hand-built OPLS-AA parameters and topologies
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing hand-built OPLS-AA force field parameters and topologies for over 400 molecules, formatted for multiple MD engines including OpenMM, GROMACS, LAMMPS, and NAMD.

tools.name: OpenMM-MD
tools.one_line_profile: General purpose script for running OpenMM simulations
tools.detailed_description: A versatile Python script developed by Lee-Ping Wang for executing molecular dynamics simulations using the OpenMM engine. It simplifies the setup and execution of standard MD protocols.

tools.name: OpenThermo
tools.one_line_profile: Program for calculating molecular thermochemistry properties from QC outputs
tools.detailed_description: OpenThermo is a C++ program that calculates thermodynamic properties (Gibbs free energy, enthalpy, entropy, heat capacity) using statistical mechanics based on output files from quantum chemistry packages like Gaussian, ORCA, VASP, and CP2K.

tools.name: QUIP
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics framework for GAP and other potentials
tools.detailed_description: QUIP is a molecular dynamics software package that implements various interatomic potentials, most notably the Gaussian Approximation Potential (GAP). It is designed for materials modeling and integrates with LAMMPS.

tools.name: matscipy
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for materials science at the atomic scale
tools.detailed_description: matscipy provides a collection of tools for materials science at the atomic scale, building upon the Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE). It includes efficient implementations of neighbor lists, coordination number analysis, and various utility functions for processing atomic structures and trajectories.

tools.name: PyRAI2MD
tools.one_line_profile: Python Rapid Artificial Intelligence Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics
tools.detailed_description: PyRAI2MD is a Python implementation of Rapid Artificial Intelligence Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics. It enables non-adiabatic molecular dynamics simulations using machine learning models to predict potential energy surfaces and couplings.

tools.name: asetk
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for Atomistic Simulation Environment (ASE)
tools.detailed_description: asetk is a collection of command-line tools and Python utilities based on the Atomistic Simulation Environment (ASE). It provides scripts for structure manipulation, file conversion, and simple analysis tasks in computational materials science.

tools.name: PyAutoFEP
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Free Energy Perturbation workflow for GROMACS
tools.detailed_description: PyAutoFEP is an automated workflow tool for performing Free Energy Perturbation (FEP) calculations using GROMACS. It integrates enhanced sampling methods and automates the setup, execution, and analysis of relative binding free energy calculations.

tools.name: Lumol
tools.one_line_profile: Extensible molecular simulation engine
tools.detailed_description: Lumol is a modern, extensible molecular simulation engine written in Rust. It is designed to be flexible and easy to extend, supporting various potentials, integrators, and simulation methods for molecular dynamics and Monte Carlo simulations.

tools.name: ComplexMixtures.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of solute-solvent interactions in complex mixtures
tools.detailed_description: ComplexMixtures.jl is a Julia package for analyzing the structure of complex mixtures from molecular dynamics simulations. It focuses on minimum-distance distribution functions (MDDF) to characterize solute-solvent interactions.

tools.name: Packmol
tools.one_line_profile: Initial configuration generator for molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: Packmol creates initial configurations for molecular dynamics simulations by packing molecules in defined regions of space. It ensures that atoms do not overlap and respects user-defined constraints, facilitating the setup of complex solvated systems.

tools.name: Deeptime
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning tools for time-series analysis of molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: Deeptime is a Python library for the analysis of time-series data, particularly from molecular dynamics simulations. It implements methods for dimension reduction, clustering, and Markov state modeling (MSM), integrating deep learning approaches like VAMPnets.

tools.name: MPmorph
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for running and analyzing AIMD calculations
tools.detailed_description: MPmorph is a collection of tools developed by the Materials Project to run and analyze ab-initio molecular dynamics (AIMD) calculations, specifically with VASP. It handles workflow management and provides analysis utilities for diffusion and structure evolution.

tools.name: MDTraj
tools.one_line_profile: Library for analysis of molecular dynamics trajectories
tools.detailed_description: MDTraj is a python library that allows users to manipulate molecular dynamics (MD) trajectories. It provides a wide variety of analysis functions, including RMSD, DSSP, and contact maps, and supports many MD trajectory file formats.

tools.name: LightAIMD
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight ab initio molecular dynamics simulation program
tools.detailed_description: LightAIMD is a lightweight software package for performing ab initio molecular dynamics simulations. It is designed for efficiency and ease of use in simulating material properties at the quantum mechanical level.

tools.name: Timewarp
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning accelerated molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: Timewarp is a research project and tool that uses deep learning to accelerate molecular dynamics simulations. It employs generative models to predict future states of a molecular system, allowing for larger time steps than conventional integration.

tools.name: Two-for-one Diffusion
tools.one_line_profile: Denoising Force Field (DFF) framework for coarse-grained MD
tools.detailed_description: This tool implements Denoising Force Fields (DFF), a method combining diffusion models and force fields for coarse-grained molecular dynamics. It allows for the training of force fields that can simultaneously generate structures and drive dynamics.

tools.name: pair_nequip_allegro
tools.one_line_profile: LAMMPS interface for NequIP and Allegro ML potentials
tools.detailed_description: This repository provides LAMMPS pair styles that enable the use of NequIP and Allegro deep learning interatomic potentials within LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: PyRAI2MD-hiam
tools.one_line_profile: Variant of PyRAI2MD for ab initio molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: This is a variant or development version of the PyRAI2MD software, providing Python-based tools for Rapid Artificial Intelligence Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics simulations.

tools.name: Faunus
tools.one_line_profile: Metropolis Monte Carlo simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: Faunus is a framework for Metropolis Monte Carlo simulations of molecular systems. It allows for flexible definition of Hamiltonians, moves, and analysis, suitable for studying equilibrium properties of fluids and soft matter.

tools.name: MISPR
tools.one_line_profile: Materials Science Productivity for Research automation
tools.detailed_description: MISPR (Materials Science Productivity for Research) is a software package for automating materials science computations. It provides workflows for setting up, running, and analyzing DFT and MD simulations, often integrating with FireWorks and pymatgen.

tools.name: Psiflow
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable molecular simulation and ML potential training
tools.detailed_description: Psiflow is a library for scalable molecular simulations, focusing on the automated training and execution of machine learning interatomic potentials. It leverages Parsl for parallel execution.

tools.name: GMSO
tools.one_line_profile: General Molecular Simulation Object for topology management
tools.detailed_description: GMSO (General Molecular Simulation Object) is a Python library for flexible storage and manipulation of chemical topology for molecular simulations. It supports applying force fields and converting between various simulation engine formats.

tools.name: azplugins
tools.one_line_profile: Soft matter simulation plugins for HOOMD-blue
tools.detailed_description: azplugins is a component for HOOMD-blue that adds features for soft matter simulations, including anisotropic particles, special potentials, and integrators not found in the core HOOMD-blue package.

tools.name: gsd-vmd
tools.one_line_profile: VMD plugin for reading HOOMD-blue GSD files
tools.detailed_description: gsd-vmd is a plugin for the Visual Molecular Dynamics (VMD) software that enables it to read and visualize GSD (General Simulation Data) files, which are commonly output by the HOOMD-blue simulation engine.

tools.name: MDANCE
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance clustering for molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: MDANCE provides O(N) clustering algorithms for molecular dynamics trajectories. It is optimized for speed and can process large datasets (e.g., millions of frames) efficiently using specialized algorithms.

tools.name: mdapy
tools.one_line_profile: Library for handling molecular dynamics data
tools.detailed_description: mdapy is a Python library designed for the efficient handling and analysis of data generated from molecular dynamics simulations. It provides functions for structure analysis, defect identification, and other post-processing tasks.

tools.name: cp2k-spm-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for simulating Scanning Probe Microscopy (SPM) images using CP2K
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python tools developed at Empa for post-processing CP2K simulation outputs to generate Scanning Probe Microscopy (STM/AFM) images.

tools.name: NAMD
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel, object-oriented molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance simulation
tools.detailed_description: NAMD is a parallel molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance simulation of large biomolecular systems. This repository mirrors the source code maintained by the National Biomedical Computation Resource (NBCR).

tools.name: Nbody6++GPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated N-body code for star cluster simulations
tools.detailed_description: Nbody6++GPU is a high-performance N-body simulation code optimized for GPU acceleration, designed for simulating the dynamical evolution of star clusters and galactic nuclei.

tools.name: OpenAWSEM
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM implementation of the AWSEM coarse-grained protein folding force field
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the AWSEM (Associative memory, Water mediated, Structure and Energy Model) coarse-grained protein folding forcefield using the OpenMM simulation toolkit.

tools.name: PySDM
tools.one_line_profile: Pythonic particle-based cloud microphysics package
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for particle-based (super-droplet) warm-rain and aqueous-chemistry cloud microphysics simulations, featuring high-performance backends.

tools.name: OpenFF Evaluator
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for physical property evaluation and force field parameterization
tools.detailed_description: A scalable framework for estimating physical properties from molecular simulation data, designed to assist in the parameterization and validation of force fields.

tools.name: OpenFF Interchange
tools.one_line_profile: Interchange object for storing and converting molecular mechanics data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for storing, manipulating, and converting molecular mechanics data between various software ecosystems (e.g., OpenMM, GROMACS, LAMMPS, AMBER).

tools.name: OpenFF Toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for molecular mechanics parameterization using SMIRNOFF

tools.detailed_description: A fully automated high-throughput molecular dynamics pipeline for setting up, running, and analyzing simulations.

tools.name: colabfit-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for interatomic potential datasets
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools for constructing and manipulating datasets used for fitting interatomic potentials, part of the ColabFit project.

tools.name: CombiFF
tools.one_line_profile: Automated force-field optimization tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for automated force-field optimization developed by the CSMS group at ETH Zürich.

tools.name: DMFF
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Molecular Force Field implementation based on Jax
tools.detailed_description: A Jax-based Python package providing a fully differentiable implementation of molecular force field models, enabling efficient parameterization and optimization.

tools.name: deepmd-gnn
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Network plugin for DeePMD-kit
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for DeePMD-kit that integrates various graph neural network models for potential energy representation.

tools.name: polanyi
tools.one_line_profile: Transition state optimization with force fields
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing transition state optimization using force field methods.

tools.name: Uni-GBSA
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for MM/GB(PB)SA calculations and force field building
tools.detailed_description: An automatic workflow to perform MM/GB(PB)SA calculations, including force field building, structure optimization, and free energy calculation.

tools.name: GRADE
tools.one_line_profile: Clathrate hydrate structure determination and analysis code
tools.detailed_description: A tool to analyze atomic positions of water molecules to determine clathrate hydrate structures (cages) and calculate order parameters from trajectories.

tools.name: ParFit
tools.one_line_profile: Automated fitting of molecular mechanics parameters
tools.detailed_description: Automates the process of fitting molecular-mechanics parameters to data obtained by ab-initio calculations.

tools.name: vaspMD
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow tools and scripts for AIMD and MLFF-MD with VASP
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts and tools to facilitate ab initio Molecular Dynamics (AIMD) and Machine Learning Force Field MD calculations using VASP.

tools.name: ABFML
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid building and fitting of machine learning force fields
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the rapid building, fitting, and application of machine learning force fields.

tools.name: OBGMX
tools.one_line_profile: GROMACS topology generator using OpenBabel UFF
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate GROMACS topologies using the UFF force field implementation from OpenBabel.

tools.name: mlip
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials
tools.detailed_description: A library designed for efficient training and application of Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials (MLIP).

tools.name: PYFIT-FF
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network interatomic potential training tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for training feed-forward artificial neural network (NN) interatomic potentials to interpolate between density functional theory energy predictions.

tools.name: mff
tools.one_line_profile: Nonparametric force fields from machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for building nonparametric force fields using machine learning techniques.

tools.name: lsfitpar
tools.one_line_profile: Robust fitting of bonded Molecular Mechanics parameters
tools.detailed_description: A program for the robust fitting of bonded Molecular Mechanics parameters.

tools.name: addNewResidue.py
tools.one_line_profile: Script to add custom residues to GROMACS forcefields
tools.detailed_description: A utility script that automates the addition of custom-made amino acids to the GROMACS forcefield directory.

tools.name: LigParGen_2.3
tools.one_line_profile: LigParGen Python package (v2.3)
tools.detailed_description: Python package implementation of LigParGen for generating OPLS-AA/CM1A parameters for organic molecules.

tools.name: ForceBalance
tools.one_line_profile: Systematic force field optimization tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for systematic force field optimization and parameterization using experimental and theoretical data.

tools.name: TSFF
tools.one_line_profile: ML force field method for transition state searching
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning force field method designed for transition state searching in catalysis.

tools.name: GenTopo
tools.one_line_profile: GROMACS topology template generator
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate GROMACS topology templates.

tools.name: maml
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for Materials Machine Learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for materials machine learning, including materials descriptors and machine learning force fields.

tools.name: LigParGen
tools.one_line_profile: Command line tool for OPLS-AA/CM1A parameters
tools.detailed_description: A command line tool providing BOSS generated OPLS-AA/CM1A(-LBCC) parameters for organic molecules and ligands.

tools.name: Conformer-Search
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for minimum energy conformer search
tools.detailed_description: A simple workflow for minimum energy conformer search based on force field optimization methods (UFF and MMFF94) available from RDKit.

tools.name: NequIP
tools.one_line_profile: E(3)-equivariant graph neural networks for interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: A code for building E(3)-equivariant interatomic potentials using graph neural networks, enabling data-efficient and accurate simulations.

tools.name: QuickFF
tools.one_line_profile: Python code to quickly derive ab initio parameterized force fields
tools.detailed_description: QuickFF is a Python package designed to derive force fields from ab initio data efficiently. It focuses on fitting force field parameters to reproduce quantum mechanical data for molecular systems.

tools.name: MLFF_QD
tools.one_line_profile: Machine Learning Force Fields for Quantum Dots
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing tools and scripts for generating and using machine learning force fields specifically tailored for quantum dot systems.

tools.name: open-forcefield-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for open forcefield development
tools.detailed_description: A collection of utility scripts and tools to support the development and maintenance of force fields within the Open Force Field Initiative.

tools.name: openff-evaluator
tools.one_line_profile: Physical property evaluation toolkit from the Open Forcefield Consortium
tools.detailed_description: A scalable framework for estimating physical properties of molecular systems to validate and optimize force field parameters. It automates the setup and execution of simulations required for property calculation.

tools.name: openff-forcefields
tools.one_line_profile: Force fields produced by the Open Force Field Initiative
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that distributes the force field files (SMIRNOFF format) produced by the Open Force Field Initiative, providing versioned access to these parameters for molecular modeling.

tools.name: openff-toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: The Open Forcefield Toolkit for SMIRNOFF format and parameterization
tools.detailed_description: The core toolkit of the Open Force Field Initiative, providing tools for molecule labeling, parameterization using the SMIRNOFF format, and interoperability with other simulation engines.

tools.name: openforcefield-forcebalance
tools.one_line_profile: Optimization of OpenFF parameters using ForceBalance and QCArchive
tools.detailed_description: A specialized workflow and configuration set for optimizing Open Force Field parameters using the ForceBalance software and quantum chemical data from QCArchive.

tools.name: kliff
tools.one_line_profile: KIM-based Learning-Integrated Fitting Framework for interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: KLIFF is a framework designed to facilitate the fitting of interatomic potentials, particularly physics-based and machine learning potentials, compatible with the OpenKIM standard.

tools.name: GAML
tools.one_line_profile: Genetic Algorithm Machine Learning for automated force field parameterization
tools.detailed_description: GAML is a software package that utilizes genetic algorithms to automate the parameterization of force fields, optimizing parameters to match reference data.

tools.name: Python-force-field-parameterization-workflow
tools.one_line_profile: Systematic and reproducible way of parameterizing a molecular force field
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based workflow designed to standardize and automate the process of developing and parameterizing molecular force fields to ensure reproducibility.

tools.name: buildH
tools.one_line_profile: Reconstruct hydrogen atoms from united-atom MD trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A tool to reconstruct all-atom representations from united-atom molecular dynamics simulations of lipids and calculate order parameters.

tools.name: SGEXT
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial Graph Extractor for analyzing graphs from images or simulations
tools.detailed_description: A library and set of scripts to extract and analyze spatial graphs, used in scientific contexts such as biopolymer simulations and vascular network analysis.

tools.name: ichor
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Chemistry Data Management Library for Machine Learning Force Field Development
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to manage computational chemistry data specifically for the purpose of developing and training machine learning force fields.

tools.name: pyiron_potentialfit
tools.one_line_profile: Fitting machine learning interatomic potentials with pyiron
tools.detailed_description: A module within the pyiron ecosystem dedicated to fitting machine learning interatomic potentials, providing a workflow for potential development.

tools.name: NAMD-MD
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts to prepare NAMD molecular dynamic simulations using LigParGen
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools and notebooks to set up molecular dynamics simulations in NAMD from scratch, utilizing LigParGen for topology generation, aiming to bypass the need for local VMD installation.

tools.name: QUBEKit
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum Mechanical Bespoke Force Field Derivation Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: QUBEKit is a toolkit for deriving bespoke force field parameters directly from quantum mechanical data, automating the parameterization process for small molecules.

tools.name: antefoyer
tools.one_line_profile: Antechamber plugin to foyer and support for the GAFF forcefield
tools.detailed_description: A plugin that integrates Antechamber functionality into the Foyer package, facilitating the use of the General Amber Force Field (GAFF) for molecular systems.

tools.name: LAMMPS-LMFF
tools.one_line_profile: Layered Materials Force Field (LMFF) expansion for LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Layered Materials Force Field (LMFF) for LAMMPS, designed to accurately simulate layered materials like graphene and boron nitride using Tersoff and inter-layer potentials.

tools.name: deepmd_on_pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: Reproduce partial features of DeePMD-kit using PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation aiming to reproduce features of the DeePMD-kit, allowing for the training and usage of Deep Potential molecular dynamics models within the PyTorch ecosystem.

tools.name: atb2lammps
tools.one_line_profile: Convert files from the ATB repository to LAMMPS format
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to convert molecular topology and parameter files from the Automated Topology Builder (ATB) repository into a format compatible with the LAMMPS simulation engine.

tools.name: eqnn-jax
tools.one_line_profile: Implementations of equivariant graph neural networks in Jax (EGNN, SEGNN, NequIP)
tools.detailed_description: A collection of annotated implementations of equivariant graph neural networks (EGNN, SEGNN, NequIP) using JAX, useful for developing machine learning potentials and analyzing molecular structures.

tools.name: MSA-2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Fitting potential energy surface using monomial symmetrization approach
tools.detailed_description: Software for fitting potential energy surfaces (PES) using the monomial symmetrization approach, aiding in the creation of accurate potentials for molecular dynamics.

tools.name: nequip-eqx
tools.one_line_profile: JAX implementation of the NequIP neural network interatomic potential
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the NequIP equivariant neural network interatomic potential using JAX and Equinox, enabling efficient training and inference of ML potentials.

tools.name: mlff
tools.one_line_profile: Build neural networks for machine learning force fields with JAX
tools.detailed_description: A framework for building and training neural network-based machine learning force fields using JAX, facilitating the development of custom potentials.

tools.name: mddatasetbuilder
tools.one_line_profile: Script to build reference datasets for training neural network potentials from LAMMPS trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A utility script designed to process LAMMPS trajectory files and convert them into reference datasets suitable for training neural network interatomic potentials.

tools.name: torchmd-net
tools.one_line_profile: Training neural network potentials with PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A library for training equivariant neural network potentials (like ET-Early, Transformer-based models) for molecular simulations, integrated with the TorchMD ecosystem.

tools.name: besmarts
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for data-driven force field design based on binary-encoded SMARTS
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit that uses binary-encoded SMARTS patterns to facilitate data-driven design and optimization of chemical force fields.

tools.name: chemtrain
tools.one_line_profile: Training Neural Network potentials through customizable routines in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A flexible library for training neural network potentials and other differentiable models in chemistry using JAX, allowing for customizable training routines.

tools.name: chipsff
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation of universal machine learning force-fields
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by NIST for evaluating and benchmarking universal machine learning force fields against reference data.

tools.name: nfflr
tools.one_line_profile: Neural force field learning toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit from NIST for learning and developing neural network force fields, providing methods for training and validation.

tools.name: LigParGen2LAMMPS.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to convert LigParGen data file to a LAMMPS molecule file
tools.detailed_description: A Julia tool designed to convert force field data files generated by LigParGen into LAMMPS-compatible molecule files for molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: pogo
tools.one_line_profile: Optimization tool for GōMartini force fields using perturbation-based approaches
tools.detailed_description: Pogo is a Python-based tool designed to optimize the GōMartini coarse-grained force field. It employs a perturbation-based approach to adjust force field parameters, aiming to reproduce atomistic ensemble properties and improve the accuracy of coarse-grained simulations.

tools.name: ReaxFF-Optimization
tools.one_line_profile: Training scripts for optimizing ReaxFF force field parameters via LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python training codes designed to optimize ReaxFF (Reactive Force Field) parameters. It interfaces with LAMMPS to run simulations and iteratively adjust parameters to minimize errors against training data.

tools.name: ybs-RPOF
tools.one_line_profile: Evolutionary algorithm framework for ReaxFF parameter optimization
tools.detailed_description: ybs-RPOF (ReaxFF Parameter Optimization Framework) is a tool for fitting ReaxFF force field parameters. It implements multiple global optimization algorithms, including Genetic Algorithms (GA), Simulated Annealing (SA), and Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO), to navigate the complex parameter space of reactive force fields.

tools.name: SpinRelax
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for computing NMR spin-relaxation parameters from MD trajectories
tools.detailed_description: SpinRelax is a computational workflow designed to analyze molecular dynamics trajectories and calculate Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) spin-relaxation parameters. It facilitates the comparison of simulation data with experimental NMR observables for structural and dynamic validation.

tools.name: ACEpotentials.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia implementation of Atomic Cluster Expansion (ACE) potentials
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for fitting and evaluating machine learning interatomic potentials based on the Atomic Cluster Expansion (ACE) framework. It provides tools for parameterizing potentials for molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: MACE-Foundations
tools.one_line_profile: Pre-trained foundation models for MACE potentials
tools.detailed_description: A repository hosting foundation models based on the MACE architecture, including models trained on the Materials Project (MP) and other large datasets, enabling zero-shot or few-shot application to materials modeling tasks.

tools.name: MACE-JAX
tools.one_line_profile: JAX implementation of MACE potentials
tools.detailed_description: The JAX implementation of the MACE interatomic potential, leveraging JAX's compilation and automatic differentiation capabilities for efficient training and inference in molecular simulations.

tools.name: MACE-Layer
tools.one_line_profile: Core equivariant graph neural network layers for MACE
tools.detailed_description: Provides the underlying higher-order equivariant graph neural network layers for 3D point clouds used in constructing MACE potentials. It serves as a building block for developing equivariant models in materials science.

tools.name: MACE-OFF
tools.one_line_profile: MACE models for organic molecules (MACE-OFF23)
tools.detailed_description: A collection of MACE models specifically trained for organic chemistry applications (MACE-OFF23), suitable for simulating organic molecules and drug-like compounds.

tools.name: MOFSimBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for ML potentials in Metal-Organic Frameworks
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking toolkit designed to evaluate the performance of universal machine learning interatomic potentials specifically for molecular modeling of Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs).

tools.name: ESP_DNN
tools.one_line_profile: GNN for predicting electrostatic potential surfaces
tools.detailed_description: A Graph-Convolutional Deep Neural Network designed to predict electrostatic potential (ESP) surfaces of molecules, facilitating rapid evaluation of molecular properties for drug discovery and chemistry.

tools.name: Equitrain
tools.one_line_profile: Unified framework for training ML interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: A unified framework designed for training and fine-tuning various machine learning interatomic potentials. It streamlines the workflow for developing potentials from ab initio data.

tools.name: PES-Learn
tools.one_line_profile: Automated generation of ML models for Potential Energy Surfaces
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that automates the generation of machine learning models for molecular Potential Energy Surfaces (PES). It handles data generation, sampling, and model training to create accurate PES representations.

tools.name: CHGNet
tools.one_line_profile: Charge-informed universal neural network potential
tools.detailed_description: A pretrained universal neural network potential that incorporates charge information for atomistic modeling. CHGNet is capable of predicting energies, forces, stresses, and magnetic moments for a wide range of materials.

tools.name: n2p2
tools.one_line_profile: Neural Network Potential Package for MD simulations
tools.detailed_description: n2p2 (Neural Network Potential Package) is a C++ software for training and using high-dimensional neural network potentials. It is widely used for atomistic simulations and integrates with LAMMPS.

tools.name: lammps-tersoff-vector
tools.one_line_profile: Vectorized Implementation of the Tersoff Potential for LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: This repository provides an optimized, vectorized implementation of the Tersoff interatomic potential for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics software, aiming to improve simulation performance for materials modeled with this potential.

tools.name: aenet-lammps
tools.one_line_profile: Interface module between aenet and LAMMPS for ANN potentials
tools.detailed_description: This package provides an interface to couple the Atomic Energy Network (aenet) software with LAMMPS, enabling the use of Artificial Neural Network (ANN) potentials trained in aenet within LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: CatBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark Framework of Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials
tools.detailed_description: CatBench is a benchmarking framework designed to evaluate the performance of Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials (MLIPs), specifically focusing on their accuracy in predicting adsorption energies in catalytic systems.

tools.name: SIMPLE-NN
tools.one_line_profile: SNU Interatomic Machine-learning PotentiaL packagE
tools.detailed_description: SIMPLE-NN is a package for generating and using neural network-based interatomic potentials. It provides tools for training potentials from ab initio data and using them for atomistic simulations.

tools.name: SPINNER
tools.one_line_profile: Structure Prediction of Inorganic crystals using Neural Network potentials
tools.detailed_description: SPINNER is a tool for predicting the structures of inorganic crystals. It combines Neural Network potentials with evolutionary and random search algorithms to efficiently explore the potential energy surface and identify stable crystal structures.

tools.name: k_SRME
tools.one_line_profile: Heat-conductivity benchmark test for foundational machine-learning potentials
tools.detailed_description: k_SRME is a benchmark suite designed to evaluate the performance of foundational machine-learning potentials specifically in the context of heat conductivity calculations, providing standardized tests for thermal properties.

tools.name: PyXtal_FF
tools.one_line_profile: Machine Learning Interatomic Potential Predictions
tools.detailed_description: PyXtal_FF is a Python package for developing and using machine learning interatomic potentials. It supports various descriptors and regression methods to model atomic interactions for materials simulations.

tools.name: gamd-openmm
tools.one_line_profile: Gaussian Accelerated Molecular Dynamics (GaMD) for OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: This repository implements Gaussian Accelerated Molecular Dynamics (GaMD) as a plugin/extension for the OpenMM simulation toolkit. It enables unconstrained enhanced sampling and free energy calculations for biomolecules.

tools.name: dem_hyperelasticity
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Energy Method for solving hyperelasticity PDEs
tools.detailed_description: Implements the 'Deep Energy Method' (DEM), a neural network-based approach to solve partial differential equations in nonlinear elasticity at finite strain by minimizing potential energy.

tools.name: nnpdf
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning framework for global analyses of parton distributions
tools.detailed_description: NNPDF is an open-source machine learning framework used in High Energy Physics to determine the parton distribution functions (PDFs) of the proton using experimental data and neural networks.

tools.name: nnpf
tools.one_line_profile: Machine Learning applied to Phase Field methods
tools.detailed_description: nnpf is a tool/framework that applies machine learning techniques to accelerate or enhance Phase Field methods, which are widely used for simulating microstructure evolution in materials.

tools.name: DScribe
tools.one_line_profile: Library for creating machine learning descriptors for atomistic systems
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for transforming atomic structures into fixed-size numerical fingerprints (descriptors) such as Coulomb matrix, Sine matrix, Ewald sum matrix, ACSF, and SOAP, suitable for machine learning models in materials science.

tools.name: PDMD
tools.one_line_profile: Potential-free Data-driven Molecular Dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A data-driven molecular dynamics simulation tool developed by TACC that bypasses explicit potential functions, using data-driven methods to propagate molecular systems.

tools.name: NNsForMD
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network class for molecular dynamics predictions
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by the AiMat lab (KIT) providing neural network classes specifically designed for molecular dynamics, capable of predicting potential energy, forces, and non-adiabatic couplings.

tools.name: AIMNet
tools.one_line_profile: Atoms In Molecules Neural Network Potential
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the AIMNet (Atoms In Molecules Neural Network) architecture, a modular and transferable neural network potential for modeling molecular systems and chemical reactions.

tools.name: aiqm-nnp
tools.one_line_profile: Common tools for PyTorch based neural network potentials
tools.detailed_description: A utility library providing common components and tools for developing and running PyTorch-based neural network potentials, maintained by the AIQM organization (developers of TorchANI).

tools.name: apax
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible and performant framework for training machine learning potentials in JAX
tools.detailed_description: Apax is a package for training machine learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs) using JAX. It focuses on scalability and performance, enabling efficient training of potentials for atomistic simulations.

tools.name: arcann_training
tools.one_line_profile: Automated enhanced sampling for generating training sets for reactive ML potentials
tools.detailed_description: A workflow tool designed to automate the generation of training datasets for chemically reactive machine learning interatomic potentials through enhanced sampling techniques.

tools.name: active-learning-md
tools.one_line_profile: Active learning workflow for generating machine learning interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: A workflow implementation for generating machine learning inter-atomic potentials driven by active learning, demonstrated on amorphous and liquid systems.

tools.name: mlip-arena
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark platform for machine learning interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: A fair and transparent benchmarking framework for machine learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs), evaluating them beyond basic error metrics to include stability and physical properties.

tools.name: SchNetPack
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Neural Networks for Atomistic Systems
tools.detailed_description: SchNetPack is a toolbox for the development and application of deep neural networks to the prediction of potential energy surfaces and other quantum-chemical properties of molecules and materials.

tools.name: G-SchNet
tools.one_line_profile: Generative neural networks for 3D molecular structures
tools.detailed_description: An extension for SchNetPack that implements G-SchNet, a generative model for sampling 3D molecular structures.

tools.name: ANI-1xnr
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning potential for reactive chemistry
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the ANI-1xnr machine learning interatomic potential designed for condensed-phase reactive chemistry simulations.

tools.name: aenet
tools.one_line_profile: Atomic Energy NETwork - ANN potentials for atomistic simulations
tools.detailed_description: The Atomic Energy NETwork (ænet) package is a collection of tools for the construction and application of atomic interaction potentials based on artificial neural networks (ANNs).

tools.name: aenet-PyTorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of the aenet package
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-supported PyTorch implementation for training machine learning atomic potentials, compatible with the original aenet framework.

tools.name: uMLIP-Interactive
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for universal machine learning interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface for running and visualizing simulations with various universal machine learning interatomic potentials like MACE, CHGNet, and SevenNet.

tools.name: Cairn.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Enhanced sampling algorithms for active learning of ML-IPs
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package implementing enhanced sampling algorithms specifically designed for the active learning of machine learning interatomic potentials (ML-IPs).

tools.name: IANN
tools.one_line_profile: Equivariant interatomic neural network potential framework
tools.detailed_description: IANN (InterAtomic Neural Network Framework) is a package for creating and training equivariant interatomic neural network potentials.

tools.name: muse
tools.one_line_profile: Builder for amorphous solids and liquid mixtures using MLIPs
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for fast building of amorphous solids and liquid mixtures structures using Materials Project data and machine learning interatomic potentials.

tools.name: modelforge
tools.one_line_profile: Infrastructure to implement and train Neural Network Potentials
tools.detailed_description: A library providing infrastructure to implement, train, and deploy neural network potentials (NNPs) for molecular simulation.

tools.name: ART-SM
tools.one_line_profile: Backmapping framework from Coarse-Grained to Atomistic resolution
tools.detailed_description: A fragment-based machine learning framework for backmapping coarse-grained (CG) structures to atomistic resolution.

tools.name: mlip-cleavage-benchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for MLIPs on surface stability and cleavage energy
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking suite for evaluating Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials (MLIPs) specifically on surface stability and cleavage energy predictions.

tools.name: DP-GEN
tools.one_line_profile: Deep potential generator workflow tool
tools.detailed_description: A workflow tool designed to generate deep-learning based models of interatomic potential energy and force fields using active learning strategies.

tools.name: ReactBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for ML-enhanced transition state search
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking tool and source code for harnessing machine learning to enhance transition state search with interatomic potentials and generative models.

tools.name: OMNI-P2x
tools.one_line_profile: Universal neural network potential for excited states
tools.detailed_description: A universal neural network potential designed specifically for modeling excited states in atomistic systems.

tools.name: curator
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for building robust machine learning potentials
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to assist in the curation of data and building of robust machine learning potentials for atomistic simulations.

tools.name: phi-module
tools.one_line_profile: Electrostatics from Laplacian Eigenbasis for NNIPs
tools.detailed_description: A module implementing electrostatics from Laplacian Eigenbasis for Neural Network Interatomic Potentials (NNIPs).

tools.name: qcnn-hep
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum CNN for HEP event classification
tools.detailed_description: A package demonstrating and implementing Quantum Convolutional Neural Networks (QCNN) for classifying High Energy Physics (HEP) events from particle image data.

tools.name: neural-optimiser
tools.one_line_profile: Batched optimisation algorithms for NNP driven MD
tools.detailed_description: A library providing batched optimization algorithms specifically tailored for molecular dynamics simulations driven by neural network potentials.

tools.name: PnP-MACE
tools.one_line_profile: PnP algorithm and MACE framework for image reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: Utilities and methods to use the Plug-and-Play (PnP) algorithm and Multi-Agent Consensus Equilibrium (MACE) framework for image reconstruction problems like CT.

tools.name: painn-jax
tools.one_line_profile: JAX implementation of PaiNN model
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the PaiNN (Polarizable Atom Interaction Neural Network) model using the JAX framework.

tools.name: grappa
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learned Molecular Mechanics force field
tools.detailed_description: A machine learned Molecular Mechanics force field integrated into GROMACS and OpenMM for molecular simulations.

tools.name: OpenMACE
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source C++ implementation of the MACE machine learning force field architecture
tools.detailed_description: OpenMACE is an open-source C++ implementation of the MACE (Multi-Atomic Cluster Expansion) architecture, designed for efficient and accurate molecular dynamics simulations using equivariant message passing neural networks.

tools.name: pantea
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based Python library for developing machine learning interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: Pantea is a library built on JAX for creating and training machine learning interatomic potentials, leveraging JAX's automatic differentiation and compilation features for efficient potential development.

tools.name: DAS
tools.one_line_profile: Dual Adaptive Sampling method for training machine learning interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: DAS (Dual Adaptive Sampling) provides a strategy for active learning in the construction of machine learning interatomic potentials, helping to select the most informative configurations for training.

tools.name: DAC-SIM
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular simulation package integrating MLFFs for Direct Air Capture in MOFs
tools.detailed_description: DAC-SIM is a molecular simulation package designed to integrate machine learning force fields (MLFFs) specifically for studying Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs) in the context of Direct Air Capture (DAC) applications.

tools.name: mlipaudit
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking and validation toolkit for Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials
